tool_description: 1001 Functions to enhance your business via API. Access a comprehensive API offering various business functions, including VAT rate lookup, geolocation, currency conversion, email validation, domain verification, BMI calculation, and more.
name: Useful Business 1001 Functions
title: Useful Business 1001 Functions

api_list.name: DetectFreeMails
api_list.description: The "Detect Free Mails" endpoint is an API that allows users to determine if an email address is a business email or a free email service. To use this endpoint, users must provide an email address as input. The endpoint will then check if the email address belongs to a free email service or not. If the email address belongs to a free email service, the endpoint will return a response indicating that the email is invalid. If the email address belongs to a business domain, the endpoint will return a response indicating that the email is valid.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com/business/isfreemail"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com/business/isfreemail"

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: ValidateVATID
api_list.description:
This endpoint can be used to check whether a value-added tax identification (VAT ID) is valid or not. The input can take two different forms: the VAT ID can be passed as a whole string, or it can be split in country code and VAT number. Examples for both requests are below this description.

| **Property** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| `vatId` | string with complete VAT ID (e.g. `"DE999999999"`). If this property is passed, there is no need for the other two. |
| `countryCode` | Two-letters country code, head of the identifier. Normally is the [ISO 3166-1 aplha-2 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Current_codes). |
| `id` | VAT Number, rest of the identifier. Usually composed only by numbers but it might contain letters in some cases. |
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com/business/validate/vat"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: DetectBIC
api_list.description: The "DetectBic" endpoint is a software API that verifies the validity of a Bank Identifier Code (BIC). To use this endpoint, users provide the BIC as an input, and the endpoint checks whether the provided BIC is valid or not. If the BIC is valid, the output will indicate that it is valid, otherwise it will indicate that it is invalid.

api_list.name: Nation To ISO
api_list.description: The "Nation to ISO" REST endpoint is an API that converts a nation's name to its corresponding ISO country code, or vice versa. Users can input either the nation name or the ISO code, and the endpoint will return the corresponding output. For example, if the input is "South Africa", the output will be "ZA", while if the input is "ES", the output will be "Spain".

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: LookupVATrates
api_list.description: The "LookupVATrates" REST endpoint is an API that provides the value-added tax (VAT) rate for a specific country. To use this endpoint, users must provide the two-letter country code for the country they wish to lookup. Once the endpoint receives this information, it will return the VAT rate as output.

api_list.name: IPtoGEOLocation
api_list.description: The "IPtoGEOLocation" REST endpoint is an API that maps IP addresses to geographical locations. Users must provide an IP address as input to retrieve the corresponding geographical location. This endpoint uses IP geolocation data to identify the latitude and longitude of the provided IP address. Users can input both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. The endpoint returns the geographical location of the provided IP address as output, including the country, region, city, latitude, and longitude.

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: DetectIBAN
api_list.description: The "DetectIBAN" REST endpoint is an API that detects whether an International Bank Account Number (IBAN) is valid or not. To use this endpoint, users must provide an IBAN number as an input. The endpoint then checks the provided IBAN number against the internationally recognized IBAN format and validates its checksum to determine if it is valid or not. If the provided IBAN number is valid, the endpoint returns a "true" value, indicating that the IBAN number is valid. If the provided IBAN number is not valid, the endpoint returns a "false" value, indicating that the IBAN number is not valid.
api_list.code:

url = "https://useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com/business/validate/iban"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "useful-business-1001-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Switch Timezone
api_list.description: The "Switch Timezone" REST endpoint is an API that allows users to convert a given timestamp from one timezone to another. To use this endpoint, users must provide the input timestamp, input timezone, and destination timezone as inputs. The endpoint then converts the input timestamp from the input timezone to the destination timezone, and returns the resulting timestamp as output.

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)

api_list.name: SplitnameLastnameandFirstname
api_list.description: The "SplitnameLastnameandFirstname" REST endpoint is an API that splits a full name into separate first and last name components. To use this endpoint, users must provide the full name to be split as input. The endpoint will then attempt to split the name into separate components based on common name patterns, such as first name, middle name(s), and last name. In the case of compound surnames, the endpoint will attempt to identify the last part of the surname as the "main" surname.
api_list.code:

        }

print(response.json())
